name: Ammonia Leak Emergency - Elefsina
description: A major ammonia leak at an industrial facility in Elefsina, near Athens, Greece. A storage tank containing 50 tons of anhydrous ammonia has ruptured, creating a toxic cloud affecting nearby residential areas and the industrial zone. Wind patterns are carrying the plume towards populated areas. Immediate hazmat response, evacuation, and containment are critical.

available_actions.name: Immediate Downwind Evacuation
available_actions.description: Urgent evacuation of all residents and workers in downwind areas within 2km radius, prioritizing schools, hospitals, and high-occupancy buildings

available_actions.name: HAZMAT Team Source Containment
available_actions.description: Deploy specialized HAZMAT teams in Level A protective suits to isolate the leak source, seal the tank, and prevent further ammonia release

available_actions.name: Water Curtain Vapor Suppression
available_actions.description: Deploy fire trucks to create water curtains that absorb and suppress ammonia vapors, reducing plume concentration and protecting downwind areas

available_actions.name: Shelter-in-Place with Sealing Instructions
available_actions.description: Instruct residents to shelter indoors, seal windows/doors, turn off ventilation, and await further instructions while monitoring air quality

available_actions.name: Integrated: Containment + Water Curtain + Selective Evacuation
available_actions.description: Simultaneous HAZMAT containment operations, water curtain deployment, and evacuation of most vulnerable populations (schools, hospitals, elderly care)

additional_concerns: Wind carrying plume towards schools and residential areas
Risk of secondary explosions if ammonia contacts ignition sources
Nearby industrial facilities with other hazardous materials

real_time_factors.leak_rate: Estimated 500 kg/hour from ruptured tank valve
real_time_factors.wind_forecast: Winds expected to shift to northeast in 4 hours (away from population centers)
real_time_factors.current_evacuations: School evacuation in progress, 2 buildings cleared
